title: What are the similarities between Bahasa Indonesia, Javanese and Sundanese? - Quora

response.answer_text: None. Only for the fact that some (if not most) Indonesian speak of them. More than 50 percent speak Indonesian and Javanese and about a quarter speak Indonesian and Sundanese. Only few speaks all three narively. The languages are not mutually intelligibe. The three languages have diffeent set of vocabularies, structure and syntaxes. Learning three of them is like learning 3 distinct foreign languages.

I heard that Sundanese and Javanese are quite related, like Dutch and German. Indonesian is further. Maybe like English and French. I am fluent in Indonesian, but I don't understand a word of Javanese. When people are talking with me, they sometimes have to ask for Indonesian words from their friends.
